sentence.text: Patient 2 had a BW of 3.5 kg and BL of 50 cm.

Clinical examination at 14 years: height 154 cm (10th centile), weight 40.2 kg (10–25th centile), OFC 53.5 cm (25th centile), inner canthal distance 28 mm (25th centile), outer canthal distance: 80 mm (3–25th centile), palpebral fissure length: 30 mm (50th centile).

The boy (Fig. 1) had blepharoptosis, epicanthus, long eyelashes, synophrys, arched eyebrows with lateral flare, high nasal root, wide nasal tip, hypoplastic alae nasi, short philtrum, a repaired umbilical hernia but no periumbilical depression, unilateral cryptorchidism, and sacral appendage (Fig. 3).
Ophthalmological examination did not show an anterior chamber abnormality.
Audiological evaluation disclosed sensorineural hearing loss of moderate severity (41–70 dB) on the left at the frequencies of 500, 1,000, and 2,000 Hz.
Radiographs of the lumbosacral region showed no abnormalities.
G-banded karyotype gave a normal male karyotype.
